rev.desc.rev.desc: After starting applying custom update wizard, an error occurs.
Detect duplicate field, do not add it and output information into except.log
FolderRights issue of oob upgrade
SM Apps Upgrade: two fields mapped to same A-table in dbdict
modify the except log message to remove licenseinfo related exception in start panel
modify the except log message to show the meaningful field type string instead of type number
modify the field type array in the set.fields panel
modify the panel return.no.merge, add statements to returen log messages to the invoker of this app.
revert previous change, since this application is a common one, the change will block upgrade utility.
Changes on Field Lenght is not applied by loading unload with dbdict change option
SCR42063 Setting $RETURN to indicate when a merge operation was not done
Set the return value to force the save on new fields.
Panel update.sql
Compare the alias field values in a case-insensitive manner (using tolower()).
Revised code on update.sql panel to make sure that a new alias table is not added to the dbdict if there are no fields in the dbdict that are assigned to that alias table. (DE2378)
Panel update.sql
Replaced call to dbdictHelper.mergeSQLTables with new expressions to merge the new and old sql tables lists.
Updating Logging logic. (DE1614)
Removing key merge code
Don't assign complex arrays and structures to elements for loging. (DE1300)
No longer treating probsummary special. (DE1311)
Changes to properly deal with merging dbdicts that have new SQL tables added. (S903)
Changes to properly bring over SQL data when merging dbdicts (S903)
On update.fields panel, removed the code that was NULLing out the sql info field information.
Modification made for CenterPoint Request 28371 Task 26312.

Corrected the problem where if a customer defines a field as a scalar field, and on the upgrade, Peregrine sends down the very same field AS A STRUCTURE (with subfileds beneath it), the upgrade will leave the scalar field alone, BUT it will go ahead and INSERT beneath it (ie, beneath the scalar field) the subfields that came down with the upgrade.

The following is a brief synopsis of the changes made to effect this modification. Please see the Tech Notes section of this ticket for a more detailed description of the changes. (The details of the change are too lengthy to include here.)
Panel start:
Added the following lines after the tenth line:
(a blank line)
$L.rem=" Initialize the following fields in preparation for the merge: "
$L.rem=" The level where an attempt to ad an invalid structure begins ($L.savBadAddLvl) "
$L.rem=" The flag that indicates whether an attempt to add an invalid structure has occurred ($L.badStcAdd) "
$L.rem=" The name of the invalid structure that we attempted to add ($L.badStcNam) "
$L.savBadAddLvl=0
$L.badStcAdd=false
cleanup($L.badStcNam)
Modified what is now currently line 19 (this USED TO BE line 11)
Panel update.fields:
Modified line 3
Modified line 4
Again, please refer to the Tech Notes section of CenterPoint Request 28371 Task 26312 for a full accounting of the modification.

descript.descript: After starting applying custom update wizard, an error occurs.
Detect duplicate field, do not add it and output information into except.log
FolderRights issue of oob upgrade
SM Apps Upgrade: two fields mapped to same A-table in dbdict
modify the except log message to remove licenseinfo related exception in start panel
modify the except log message to show the meaningful field type string instead of type number
modify the field type array in the set.fields panel
modify the panel return.no.merge, add statements to returen log messages to the invoker of this app.
revert previous change, since this application is a common one, the change will block upgrade utility.
Changes on Field Lenght is not applied by loading unload with dbdict change option
SCR42063 Setting $RETURN to indicate when a merge operation was not done
Set the return value to force the save on new fields.
Panel update.sql
Compare the alias field values in a case-insensitive manner (using tolower()).
Revised code on update.sql panel to make sure that a new alias table is not added to the dbdict if there are no fields in the dbdict that are assigned to that alias table. (DE2378)
Panel update.sql
Replaced call to dbdictHelper.mergeSQLTables with new expressions to merge the new and old sql tables lists.
Updating Logging logic. (DE1614)
Removing key merge code
Don't assign complex arrays and structures to elements for loging. (DE1300)
No longer treating probsummary special. (DE1311)
Changes to properly deal with merging dbdicts that have new SQL tables added. (S903)
Changes to properly bring over SQL data when merging dbdicts (S903)
On update.fields panel, removed the code that was NULLing out the sql info field information.
Modification made for CenterPoint Request 28371 Task 26312.

Corrected the problem where if a customer defines a field as a scalar field, and on the upgrade, Peregrine sends down the very same field AS A STRUCTURE (with subfileds beneath it), the upgrade will leave the scalar field alone, BUT it will go ahead and INSERT beneath it (ie, beneath the scalar field) the subfields that came down with the upgrade.

The following is a brief synopsis of the changes made to effect this modification. Please see the Tech Notes section of this ticket for a more detailed description of the changes. (The details of the change are too lengthy to include here.)
Panel start:
Added the following lines after the tenth line:
(a blank line)
$L.rem=" Initialize the following fields in preparation for the merge: "
$L.rem=" The level where an attempt to ad an invalid structure begins ($L.savBadAddLvl) "
$L.rem=" The flag that indicates whether an attempt to add an invalid structure has occurred ($L.badStcAdd) "
$L.rem=" The name of the invalid structure that we attempted to add ($L.badStcNam) "
$L.savBadAddLvl=0
$L.badStcAdd=false
cleanup($L.badStcNam)
Modified what is now currently line 19 (this USED TO BE line 11)
Panel update.fields:
Modified line 3
Modified line 4
Again, please refer to the Tech Notes section of CenterPoint Request 28371 Task 26312 for a full accounting of the modification.
